verses.name: Jonah 4:1
verses.text: But it displeased Jonah exceedingly, and he was very angry.

verses.name: Jonah 4:2
verses.text: And he prayed unto the Lord, and said, I pray thee, O Lord, was not this my saying, when I was yet in my country? Therefore I fled before unto Tarshish: for I knew that thou art a gracious God, and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repentest thee of the evil.

verses.name: Jonah 4:3
verses.text: Therefore now, O Lord, take, I beseech thee, my life from me; for it is better for me to die than to live.

verses.name: Jonah 4:4
verses.text: Then said the Lord, Doest thou well to be angry?
